alert.note: Alert for Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 9:50AM CDT until July 13 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR WINSTON COUNTY... At 950 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Louisville. Between 4 and 10 inches of rain have fallen across parts of the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Louisville, Noxapater, Millcreek, Betheden and Mcmillan. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
